message:
SYSTEM: Wiki: https://delicias.dia.fi.upm.es/wiki/index.php/OEG_Hadoop_Cluster 

/etc/hosts on your machine
Put this line in your /etc/hosts file
138.100.15.168    denebola
/etc/hosts on denebola
Put your IP address and your computer name in denebola's /etc/hosts file. Ask Freddy to do this
$HOME/.ssh/authorized_keys on your machine
put denebola public ssh key in your machine ssh authorized keys
ssh-rsa  hduser@denebola
conf/slaves on denebola
Put your computer name in denebola conf/slaves file. Ask Freddy to do this
conf/core-site.xml on your machine
<!-- In: conf/core-site.xml -->
<property>
  <name>fs.default.name</name>
  <value>hdfs://denebola:54310</value>
  <description>The name of the default file system.  A URI whose
  scheme and authority determine the FileSystem implementation.  The
  uri's scheme determines the config property (fs.SCHEME.impl) naming
  the FileSystem implementation class.  The uri's authority is used to
  determine the host, port, etc. for a filesystem.</description>
</property>
conf/mapred-site.xml on your machine
<!-- In: conf/mapred-site.xml -->
<property>
  <name>mapred.job.tracker</name>
  <value>denebola:54311</value>
  <description>The host and port that the MapReduce job tracker runs
  at.  If "local", then jobs are run in-process as a single map
  and reduce task.
  </description>
</property>
References
http://www.michael-noll.com/tutorials/running-hadoop-on-ubuntu-linux-single-node-cluster/
http://www.michael-noll.com/tutorials/running-hadoop-on-ubuntu-linux-multi-node-cluster/
